intro: Coussapoa brenesii, commonly known as the Guanacaste tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and lowland forests. The tree can reach heights of up to 20 meters and has a long lifespan, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
